intro: Siphocampylus costaricae, commonly known as the Costa Rican siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent. Siphocampylus costaricae is adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
